Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT

License #: CI410201226
Licensee Group Organization: Wedgwood Christian Services
Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Jason Lheureux
Agency Name: KENTWOOD CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3290 36TH ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/01/2025
Capacity: 36

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, youth's boyfriend inappropriately touched
her thighs. Other residents of the facility have also inappropriately
touched youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 7, 2023. Youth A reported she was glad to be back at
the facility and felt safe. Consultant asked Youth A if she
remembers talking with Law Enforcement 1 before going to the
hospital and she reported she did. Youth A reported she does not
remember fully what she talked about and reported her new
2

medication is “making her brain fuzzy.” Youth A was asked if
anyone at the facility has made her feel uncomfortable or touched
her inappropriately and she denied. She reported if anyone was to
touch her or make her feel uncomfortable, she would tell a staff
member because she feels safe with them. Youth A reported staff
are always supervising the youth and follow safety plans. She
reported she has never had an issue with any of her current or
past peers.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 7, 2023. Supervisor reported she was involved with
the incident of Youth A attempting to run into traffic on August 24,
2023. Supervisor reported she went with Youth A to the hospital.
She processed with Youth A about the events leading up to
coming to the hospital. Youth A reported she was upset that her
mother was not able to visit that day which is why she tried to run
into the road. Supervisor reported while at the hospital Youth A
reported on an unknown date, Youth A went into the kitchen to
throw trash out and Youth C ran up to her and kissed her.
Supervisor reported she asked Youth A more questions like a
potential date, if this was wanted, and if the staff were around and
Youth A just giggled. Supervisor reported Youth A noted she
thought Staff 3 was in the kitchen during that time but was not fully
sure. Supervisor reported Youth A is an advocate for herself and
is known to report any concerns she may have. Supervisor
reported on the unit there is a weekly questionnaire given to the
youth and one of the questions is about the youth feeling safe.
She reported there was never a questionnaire turned in noting
safety concerns. Supervisor reported there was a rumor Youth A
and Youth C were “dating” and this was discussed at multiple
team meetings to make sure heightened supervision was
occurring. The heightened supervision meant the two of them
would not sit next to one another in the van, there was always
space when sitting on the couch, and a reminder that no two
youths should be left unsupervised. Supervisor reported there was
never any noted concerns of inappropriate behaviors between the
two youth.
Youth C was interview via phone on September 19,
2023. Youth C reported they dated Youth A for a short period.
Youth C reported Youth C and Youth A would give each other
compliments and would joke around. They reported there was
never any inappropriate touching or kissing. Youth C reported
when they were getting discharged from the program, they briefly
kissed Youth A on the forehead and never any other time. When
asked where it occurred, Youth C could not remember exactly but
3

noted it was not in the kitchen area. Youth C reported they clearly
remember it was the day of their discharge as they were leaving
the program. They reported they do not believe any staff saw
because it was quick, and it was right before they left to move.
Youth C reported they do not have any concerns with the staff’s
level of supervision at the facility and staff was always watching
the youth. They reported they were never left alone with another
youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on September 12,
2023. Staff 3 reported he worked at the facility when Youth A and
Youth C were both residing there. He reported he has never seen
any inappropriate actions between the two youth and does not
remember a time when they were both in the kitchen. Staff 3
reported whenever a youth is out of their rooms or bathrooms they
need to be in the line of sight of staff, a youth needs to have a
staff member in the kitchen with them, and when youth sit on the
couch there needs to be a cushion of space in between. Staff 3
reported staff were aware Youth A and Youth C were making
comments about dating one another so staff made sure there was
always appropriate space between the two of them. He reported
he never heard any allegations of them physically touching at any
time. Staff 3 reported Youth A is vocal about her concerns when
she is feeling uncomfortable to staff, and this is the first time of
him hearing this concern.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 7, 2023. Youth B reported things have been going
well at the facility and she feels safe there. She reported she gets
annoyed with staff because they are always in everyone’s
business. Youth B reported if something is happening between the
youth, staff are in the middle of it and know all about it. She
reported she has never heard or seen anyone being touched
inappropriately on the unit. Youth B reported staff have never left
two youth alone and are always watching them in the milieu area.
She reported if there was anyone who came into her personal
space, she would ask them to leave and report it to staff. Youth B
reported there is a weekly questionnaire that Supervisor hands out
to the youth to get feedback on how things are going. She
reported one of the questions asked about safety and how to keep
others safe which has been helpful to make her voice feel heard.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 7, 2023. Therapist reported Youth A never disclosed
another peer or anyone at the facility touched her inappropriately.
She reported Youth A has been open in therapy sessions and is a
4

strong advocate for herself. Therapist reported there was a rumor
Youth A was dating Youth C. She reported staff were aware of this
so there was close attention to supervision and there were no
reported concerns. Therapist reported staff should always have
youth in the line of sight when in the milieu and kitchen area.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 7, 2023. Staff 1 reported the supervision policy at the
facility is that no two youth should ever be left alone, if the youth
are in the milieu then staff need to have constant eyes on
supervision, if a youth is in the kitchen a staff member needs to be
in there with them, and if a youth is in their room then room
checks need to be completed in variable intervals no more than 15
minutes. Staff 1 reported he has not heard of any concerns from
youth of being touched inappropriately or feeling uncomfortable
around other youth. He reported he was working at the facility
when Youth C was placed there. Staff 1 reported there was a
rumor Youth C and Youth A were dating and this was talked about
at team meetings to make sure staff had a close eye on them. He
reported there were never reported concerns of them touching or
kissing one another. He reported Youth A is good at voicing her
feelings when she does not like something and never heard any
concerns from her.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 7, 2023. Staff 2 reported she has not heard any
reports from any youth about feeling uncomfortable or anyone
touching anyone inappropriately. She reported supervision policy
for this facility is that when youth are in the milieu staff need to
have eyes on and youth have appropriate spacing between one
another. Staff 2 reported no two youth should ever be left alone
and staff need to be in the kitchen with a youth when they are in
there. Staff 2 reported she did not work on this unit when Youth C
was placed there.
Documents reviewed:
- Email from Youth A’s Foster Care Worker dated
08/25/2023- Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported Youth
A has communicated in the past that there was a peer at
the facility that was “creepy.” It was reported the youth was
going around stating they had a crush on all the female
youth and has followed her around but never touched her.
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported they asked Youth A
what staff does to address this peer’s inappropriate
behaviors, and Youth A reported staff either restrain the
peer or ground him. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported
5

that they have been in communication with Wedgwood
about these incidents and they have been addressing it and
reporting it appropriately. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker
reported the allegations against Youth C, Youth A never
reported any sexual assault concerns to them. Youth A’s
Foster Care worker reported they have not had any
concerns regarding the level of supervision at the facility.
- Email from Law Enforcement 1/Complaint Source dated
08/29/2023- Law Enforcement 1 reported Youth A was
venting frustrations to him and made vague statements
about her boyfriend at the facility touching her thigh. There
were no disclosures on names or dates of this occurring.
He reported Supervisor was on scene during this
disclosure.
- Email from Law Enforcement 2 dated 08/30/2023- Law
Enforcement 2 reported due to Youth A being
uncooperative and making vague statements about the
touching the criminal case will be closed. If Youth A was to
disclose more information or request to talk with Law
Enforcement 2 then the criminal case can be reopened.
- Youth A’s Incident report log from facility dated
03/10/2023-08/24/2023- All incident reports that were
completed at the facility involving Youth A was reviewed since
the time of her placement there on 02/17/2023. There were no
incident reports noting any concerns of Youth A reporting
being touched inappropriately by another peer and no incident
reports indicating staff witnessing an inappropriate touch of
another peer to Youth A.
- Facility’s Staff Ratio Procedure- This procedure notes staff
are required to maintain line-of-sight supervision of youths at
all times expect when youth are in their individual sleeping
rooms or bathrooms.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as they supervised the youth
following the agency supervision policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
September 18, 2023
